programme.title: JAG: Secrets
programme.desc: Admiral Chegwidden, Mac and Bud Roberts are taken hostage in the Admiral's office by Pvt. Magida, a Marine who escaped from a nearby Federal prison.

programme.title: JAG: Ghosts
programme.desc: Harm and Mac investigate an attempt on Admiral Chedwiggen's life and uncover the fact that all the members of his former SEAL team have died under mysterious circumstances.

programme.title: JAG: Full Engagement
programme.desc: While on their day off, Harm takes Mac for a flight in his vintage airplane, only to be forced to make an emergency landing in a mountain clearing because of mechanical problems.

programme.title: JAG: Cowboys and Cossaks
programme.desc: Harm, Mac, and Bud are assigned sea duty to monitor a joint war games exercise between U.S. and Russian naval forces.

programme.title: JAG: The Guardian
programme.desc: Harm and Mac defend Bauwer, a former Navy Seal, now a homeless man, who's accused of using excessive force when he killed three men who tried to hold up a convenience store.

programme.title: JAG: Rendevous
programme.desc: Mac and Harm once again find themselves courtroom adversaries as Mac is assigned the difficult task of defending CPO Holst, an admitted wife abuser accused of murdering his wife's boyfriend.

programme.title: JAG: Vanished
programme.desc: Concerns regarding the mysterious disappearance of a fully armed Navy F-14 during a storm lead Harm's investigation to consider such diverse scenarios as pilot suicide, terrorism, the Bermuda Triangle curse, or UFO interference.

programme.title: JAG: King of the Fleas
programme.desc: Having just stabbed a man on a street-corner, Willie, a wheelchair-bound former Vietnam POW arrives at JAG headquarters to report "a 30-year-old murder" which he's just committed. Willie relates that while imprisoned he knew Harm's father.

programme.title: JAG: Against All Enemies
programme.desc: Harm, Mac and Bud board an aircraft carrier in the Sea of Japan to investigate the accidental shooting down of a North Korean civilian airliner by Navy jets.

programme.title: JAG: Impact
programme.desc: Harm and Bud investigate the crash of a Marine helicopter whose dead pilot is being blamed for the incident. They discover the chopper seems to have been hit by some form of UFO. Government security officials want to maintain a cover-up at all costs.

programme.title: JAG: People V. Rabb
programme.desc: Harm is arrested by the FBI for the murder of Konaplanik, a Russian who was selling Harm supposedly accurate information about his missing father's whereabouts. The killer turns out to be Col. Tomashevsky, a Russian agent.

programme.title: JAG: Defensless
programme.desc: A woman Navy ensign shoots and kills a Turkish colonel; she claims self-defense.

programme.title: JAG: With Intent to Die
programme.desc: With help from Harm, Mac, Harriet, and Bud, Admiral Chedwiggen investigates the apparent suicide of his mentor, Admiral Clancy, who allegedly shot himself while on a hunting trip. Harm and company ultimately uncover who the killer was.

programme.title: JAG: Father's Day
programme.desc: Mac and Harm are assigned the task of defending a young Marine whose frustration at being unable to wrest custody of his son has led to his being court-martialed for dereliction of duty.

programme.title: JAG: Tiger, Tiger
programme.desc: Harm takes Josh on a weekend cruise for Navy families aboard a frigate. When the frigate is taken over by terrorists who intend to fire missiles at Cuba, Harm and Bud take matters into their own hands to stop the evil plot.

programme.title: JAG: Return of Mimmy Blackhorse
programme.desc: An Army forensic pathologist joins forces with Harm, Mac, Bud and Harriet as they try to verify that newly unearthed human remains are those of a heroic Navajo "code-talker" who had been missing since WWII.

programme.title: JAG: The Imposter
programme.desc: Harm is held captive by Palmer, a renegade government agent with whom he had crossed swords a few months ago. While Palmer prepares a life mask so he can pass for Harm, he explains his plans to assassinate the key witness in the trial.

programme.title: JAG: Gypsy Eyes
programme.desc: Unable to lose the pursuing Russian fighters, Harm's and Mac’s hijacked Mig is shot out of the sky over Siberia.

programme.title: JAG: Act of Terror
programme.desc: When Arab terrorists attach a mine to a US Navy warship in an attempt to sink it, Marine guards are able to kill one and capture the other, even after the mine explodes, killing two sailors.

programme.title: JAG: The Black Jet
programme.desc: Harm and Mac are sent to Teheran, Iran to represent a Navy flier whose Stealth jet crashed in Iran due to a major mechanical failure.

programme.title: JAG: Silent Service
programme.desc: Mac and Harm are having trouble relating...a result of working together under stress for so long.

programme.title: JAG: True Calling
programme.desc: When a petty officer smuggles a pregnant Serbian woman aboard the carrier in order to save her from a vengeful fiancée, he's arrested and scheduled to be court-martialed.

programme.title: JAG: Psychic Warrior
programme.desc: When a Navy research project involving ESP and psychic phenomenon goes awry, resulting in the death of one of the research subjects, the Admiral in charge is court-martialed.(n)

programme.title: JAG: Rouge
programme.desc: As the lowest ranking lawyer at JAG, Bud is assigned to accompany Raglan, a former Special Forces operative who is hired by the Pentagon to test security at military bases.(n)

programme.title: JAG: Mishap
programme.desc: Skates", Harm's RIO when he was aboard the USS Patrick Henry, was the Landing Safety Officer in charge of the deck when a Tomcat crashes while making an emergency landing.(n)

programme.title: JAG: King of the Greenie Board
programme.desc: Harm is now a Tomcat division commander aboard the carrier USS Patrick Henry that is patrolling the Mediterranean near Yugoslavia.(c)

programme.title: JAG: Rules of Engagement
programme.desc: The Russians are furious over the killing of their peacekeepers and the Navy sends Mac, Brumby, and Roberts to the Patrick Henry to conduct the court-martial of Lt. Buxton.(c)

programme.title: JAG: True Calling
programme.desc: When a petty officer smuggles a pregnant Serbian woman aboard the carrier in order to save her from a vengeful fiancée, he's arrested and scheduled to be court-martialed.(c)

programme.title: Scorpion: Maroon 8
programme.desc: While en route to Toby and Happy's honeymoon, Team Scorpion's plane crash lands on a remote deserted island, leaving them all with little hope for rescue.

programme.title: Scorpion: Scorp Family Robinson
programme.desc: Three weeks after they crash land on a deserted island, tensions run high for Team Scorpion when they must battle to overcome their relationship obstacles with each other in order to be rescued.

programme.title: Scorpion: Extinction
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must work with their old nemesis Mark Collins in order to prevent the extinction of mankind. Also, Walter and Paige awkwardly navigate their new relationship. Josh Leonard guest stars.

programme.title: Scorpion: More Extinction
programme.desc: Team Scorpion continues to work with their nemesis, Mark Collins, in order to prevent an extinction event that could end humanity. Also, Cabe's last-minute decision while on the case leads to the possible end of his career.

programme.title: Scorpion: Grow a Deer, A Female Deer
programme.sub-title: Grow a Deer, A Female Deer
programme.desc: When poachers almost kill a pregnant endangered deer, Team Scorpion recreates the animal's womb to try to save it and its baby's life. Also, Happy and Toby discuss the future of their family.

programme.title: Scorpion: Nuke Kids on the Block
programme.desc: While decommissioning an old nuclear missile, a simple accident causes Team Scorpion to endure exposure to toxic vapor while trying to prevent the nuke from detonating.

programme.title: Scorpion: Queen Scary
programme.desc: At Halloween, Team Scorpion takes on a case to prove the existence of ghosts on the Queen Mary but find an all-too-real disaster when they locate a 'ghost ship' on a deadly collision course.

programme.title: Scorpion: Go With the Florence
programme.desc: While tracking a device that can prevent a nuclear meltdown through the Los Angeles sewers, Walter learns the nuances of listening and not offering advice to Paige.

programme.title: Scorpion: Faire is Foul
programme.desc: For Sylvester's birthday, Team Scorpion visits a renaissance festival, but the revelry is cut short when a group tries to rob a nearby police evidence locker.

programme.title: Scorpion: It's Raining Men (Of War)
programme.desc: On Thanksgiving, Team Scorpion's new neighbor, Florence \, joins them at sea on a mission to destroy a floating island of trash, but her flawed contribution leaves her, Walter and Happy stranded on the quickly dissolving island.

programme.title: Scorpion: Crime Every Mountain
programme.desc: As Cabe's trial looms over Team Scorpion, a simple case goes sideways when they help a father and his daughter whose plane crashes nearby.

programme.title: Scorpion: Who Let the Dog Out ('Cause Now It's Stuck in a Cistern)
programme.sub-title: Who Let the Dog Out ('Cause Now It's Stuck in a Cistern)
programme.desc: As Team Scorpion anxiously awaits the verdict of Cabe's trial which could send him to prison, they focus their nervous energy on trying to save a dog stuck in a cistern.

programme.title: Scorpion: A Christmas Car-Roll
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, when Walter chooses work over spending quality time with his friends, he falls down the stairs and hits his head, and as he lays unconscious, he enters a dream world where Team Scorpion never existed.

programme.title: Scorpion: The Bunker Games
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must work with Toby's nemesis, Quincy Berkstead and his wife, Amy , when they are locked inside an artificially intelligent doomsday bunker that aims to kill them.

programme.title: Scorpion: The Bunker Games
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must work with Toby's nemesis, Quincy Berkstead and his wife, Amy , when they are locked inside an artificially intelligent doomsday bunker that aims to kill them.

programme.title: Scorpion: Lighthouse of the Rising Sun
programme.desc: A solar storm knocks out power in Los Angeles, and Team Scorpion must help a teen pilot and his girlfriend who are lost over the Pacific without navigation or radio contact.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Wave Goodbye
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must prevent an incoming tsunami from hitting a vulnerable nuclear power facility, and Toby secretly helps his ex-fiancée retrieve her stolen identity.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Nerd, Wind and Fire
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day, Team Scorpion must set aside their romantic plans to help a doctor and pilot trapped inside a helicopter that crashed atop a skyscraper.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: The Kids Are Not Alright
programme.desc: Andy has her sights set on a much-needed long weekend. But when a routine highway check leads to the discovery of a teenage boy in the trunk of a car, Andy and Gail must convince him that no heartache lasts forever.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Poison Pill
programme.desc: After a messy drug arrest, Andy and Marlo are quarantined together. Meanwhile, 15 Division springs into emergency response mode in order to get the contaminated drugs off the streets before a deadly outbreak sweeps through the city.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Skeletons
programme.desc: When a young woman is reported missing, the officers of 15 Division soon discover a possible copycat connection to one of their division’s most distressing cases. With the clock ticking, Gail must face her worst fears..

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Friday the 13th
programme.desc: When human bones found in a ravine open up a 15-year-old missing persons case, Swarek reunites with his old training officer to solve the case.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: For Better, For Worse
programme.desc: Everyone at 15 Division, especially Andy, just wants a quick, smooth shift so they can get to Frank and Noelle’s wedding. But things get complicated when they get called to a hijacked casino bus full of senior citizens.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: What I Lost
programme.desc: When Chris returns for a visit, his reunion takes a shocking turn when his son, Christian, is abducted while under the care of Andy and Nick.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: You Are Here
programme.desc: Near the end of shift, 15 Division busts a marijuana grow-op – a case that becomes Traci’s first homicide and forces Andy, Nick and Gail to work overtime.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Deception
programme.desc: When a suspected pedophile is found beaten within an inch of his life, Andy discovers Marlo has been conducting a mania-fueled, off-hours “investigation”.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Under Fire
programme.desc: After Andy and Chloe take fire from an unseen shooter, the officers realize they are the targets of someone with a grudge against 15 Division.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: You Can See the Stars
programme.desc: In the wake of a targeted attack on the officers of 15 Division (ep. 412), Andy, Swarek, and their fellow officers have to piece together the truth about a past crime in order to find Oliver Shaw – in time to save his life.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
programme.sub-title: The First Day of the Rest of Your Life
programme.desc: When a mysterious young girl vanishes from the scene of a multi-car accident, Andy McNally connects the girl to a 7-year-old cold case.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Girl’s Night Out
programme.desc: On Traciʼs first day as a detective, all hell breaks loose when a carload of girls from a bachelorette party hits another vehicle, killing the driver. Jerry discovers that the driver of the parked car was dead before the accident.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Messy Houses
programme.desc: While answering a domestic disturbance call, Andyʼs personal life is turned inside out when the social worker on the scene turns out to be her estranged mother.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Coming Home
programme.desc: A noise complaint leads Andy and Swarek to an illegal warehouse party, and to an injured John Doe -- a homeless squatter whoʼs been stabbed in the warehouse.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Leap of Faith
programme.desc: When a gifted psychic - or, at the very least, a gifted conman - enters 15 Division to help find the missing witness in an organized-crime case, the officers are forced to come face-to-face with some of the hidden truths.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Class Dismissed
programme.desc: As local high schools wind to a close for summer, dangerous pranks abound – including the theft of an armed police car. While tracking down the stolen vehicle, Andy and Swarek pick up the trail of a volatile teen boy.(c)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: A Good Shoot
programme.desc: Dov Epstein happens upon a convenience store robbery-in-progress that results in him shooting a young black teenager.(c)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bishton Hall P1
programme.desc: Stuart investigates the main house and seems to be pulled in different directions from an unexplained energy.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bishton Hall P2
programme.desc: Karl ventures down into the cellars of this large country house and soon comes under attack from an unseen force.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Borwick Hall P1
programme.desc: Karl enters Borwick Hall for the first time as he investigates the upper floors.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Borwick Hall P2
programme.desc: Our investigation into Borwick Hall continues as Stuart investigates the middle floors.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bron-Y-Garth Hospital Pt1
programme.desc: Stuart ventures into Bron-Y-Garth, an old workhouse and abandoned hospital. The spirits that reside here are said to be plentiful, something Stuart finds out all to soon.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Bron-Y-Garth Hospital Pt2
programme.desc: Karl takes on the formidable cell block of Bron-Y-Garth, a former workhouse and abandoned hospital. The dark corridors are said to house many an aggressive entity, and soon Karl finds out first-hand what it they capable of in a climactic end.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Champness Hall
programme.desc: Yvette, Karl & Stuart investigate the pride of Rochdale, Champness Hall. With loud footsteps and strange noises, the team seem to be followed by a persistent spirit.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Chillingham Castle
programme.desc: Karl & Stuart take on one of the Most Haunted rooms in this ancient castle. Whatever is there, seems desperate to make itself known.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt1
programme.desc: The famous Air Museum in Doncaster houses many an artefact of aviation history and many spirit from its past. Karl investigates one of the huts that is said to be full of paranormal happenings, and he isn’t disappointed.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt2
programme.desc: The main hanger of Doncaster Air Museum is a vast building and houses flying aircraft of every kind. Stuart ventures alone and soon realises something is there with him.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: Yvette and the Most Haunted team are invited to the inner sanctum of the Freemasons to investigate the many ghost sightings at Clifton Hall. Even before the investigation starts the team are faced with some of strange phenomena witnessed by others.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: Part two of their investigation into Clifton Hall sees the team splitting with going it alone. For one of the team the night becomes terrifying as they find themselves locked in a room with an unseen force.

programme.desc: Once a prison camp during WWII, Eden Camp is now a museum housing many an artefact and many a ghost. Karl enters the cottage to face the spirits that are said to haunt this once family home.

programme.desc: Russell tries to get out of his marriage to an overly enthused Liz, who tries to make it work, while Jeff attempts to engage Audrey in dirty talk.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey Is Dumb
programme.desc: Jeff celebrates Audrey's inability to talk after her node removal surgery. Russell gets Timmy to fire an employee for him, and Adam discovers he's only getting free stuff because of his good looks.

programme.desc: Everyone spends a weekend in Vermont to watch the leaves change. During the trip, Adam gets poison ivy on his hands, Jeff has an embarrassing experience on the inn's computer, and Liz begins to realize that her marriage is a sham.

programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey engage in a battle of wills when she refuses to admit that she hates the armchair she ordered while Jeff pretends to love it.

programme.desc: Frustrated by his boss blaming him for burning his mouth on hot soup, Timmy has a special spoon created for Russell. Audrey's plan backfires when she tries to seduce Jeff in the bedroom in order to get him to complete household tasks.

programme.desc: Timmy wants to reconnect with a woman he met on the subway; Jeff and Audrey turn on each other when former friends snub them.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Goodbye Dolly
programme.desc: Audrey tries to prepare for motherhood by continuing to repair a doll that she keeps damaging. Meanwhile, Jeff questions whether the very pregnant Brenda should be dating anymore, and Adam tries to convince Jennifer that he is a manly man.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey's Shower
programme.desc: Jen puts the wrong date on the invitations to Audrey's baby shower, Jeff likes Audrey's maternity clothes, and Russell gives up women.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Liz Moves In
programme.desc: Liz temporarily moves in with Jeff and Audrey. Jeff isn't happy with the new guest, but changes his mind when he discovers Liz consistently takes his side against Audrey.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Taking Names
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey realize that the names on their baby list are also the names of women that Russell has slept with. Adam becomes a cycling enthusiast after Jennifer suggests they start riding bikes in the park.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: Feeling lonely after her cat dies, Liz looks for a sperm donor. When Timmy's intellect and innocence don't attract his crush, he tries his hand at playing 'big dog.' Adam rips the vintage wedding dress that Jennifer's family sent her.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cupcake
programme.desc: Russell gets jealous when Timmy manages to outshine him at his own pick-up game. Adam and Jennifer leave pot-laced cupcakes on the kitchen counter, and an unaware Jeff eats one.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Fountain Of Youth
programme.desc: After meeting up with college friends who are no longer into partying, Jeff and Audrey set out to prove that even with a baby on the way, they can still have fun. Meanwhile, Timmy attempts to find Russell's compassionate side.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Baby Talk
programme.desc: When Audrey bonds with their unborn baby by reading her stories, a paranoid Jeff believes that she is trying to form an alliance against him. Meanwhile, Russell steals an article that Timmy wrote.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Role Play
programme.desc: Jeff promises to take Audrey to an upmarket and very popular restaurant but forgets to book a table. Determined to dine there, he hatches a plan to get in by claiming that a last-minute reservation is needed for a celebrity.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Catering
programme.desc: Brenda enlists Jeff and Audrey's help when she does the catering for an event at Columbia University. While waitressing, Audrey tries to fit in with the guests, only to discover that they are more impressed with Jeff's bartending skills.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: A Wee Problem
programme.desc: Jeff does his best to make a heavily pregnant Brenda laugh when he discovers that she has a `wee problem' due to her condition, but his antics cause her waters to break. Meanwhile, Adam annoys Audrey with his non-stop chatter during a spa visit.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Timmy Quits
programme.desc: Audrey has always had suspicions that Jeff's old college friend Heidi harbours romantic feelings for him, so Jeff invites Heidi over to prove that this was never the case.(g)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: 100th
programme.desc: Brenda goes into labor on Jen and Adam's wedding day, but Jeff has reservations about being in the delivery room. Adam persuades Jen to make some alternative arrangements for their marriage ceremony.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Rules of Engagement: Pilot
programme.desc: Adam and Jennifer are a 20-something couple who have gotten engaged and moving in together after just seven months of dating. Meanwhile, their neighbors Jeff and Audrey who have been married for twelve years try to set a good example.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Birthday Deal
programme.desc: Though he's unhappy that Audrey spent more than usual for his birthday party, Jeff wants to stay on her good side to ensure he gets his yearly birthday deal. Though Jeff won't reveal the 'deal.'.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Young and the Restless
programme.desc: After Adam has too many restless nights sleeping in Jennifer’s small bed, he brings home the bed he shared with his ex-girlfriend which causes a fight and leads them tossing out all memories of past relationships.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Hard Day's Night
programme.desc: Jennifer tries to help Jeff’s sore neck with a massage until the situation between them becomes uncomfortable and upsets Audrey. Meanwhile, Russell brings Adam along to help him fight off a school yard bully so Russell can get close to the teacher.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Kids
programme.desc: Adam and Jennifer’s plans for a romantic weekend fall apart after they argue about their different feelings toward careers, finances, and kids. Meanwhile, Audrey is having second thoughts about why she and Jeff have waited so long to have children.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cooking Class
programme.desc: The couples attempt to enjoy recreational cooking classes together, but Jeff and Adam can't keep their competitive nature out of the kitchen. Russell doesn't notice how disturbingly similar his new girlfriend is to Timmy.(c)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Unpleasant Surprises
programme.desc: When Jennifer learns that the guys have nothing planned for Adam's last weekend as a bachelor, she plans a party weekend. Things don't go as planned, however, so Jeff, Russell, and Timmy must improvise.(c)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tears for Fears
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa wakes up in a jail cell, but ignores the ensuing media frenzy in order to befriend a woman waging a personal battle against drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Picture This
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tag, You're It
programme.desc: To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook! A word to the wise for those on the run-post at your own peril, the Dog is watching!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A Family Affair
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Training Day
programme.desc: While the team tries to handle the bond that newcomer Alysin wrote incorrectly, sparks are flying between Beth and Duane Lee when he questions Beth's decision to go on the hunt without Dog leading the charge!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Cutting the Apron Strings
programme.desc: Two different young men both have a bad habit of missing their court dates. Looking over their files Dog senses that they have another trait in common, both are a little too tied to their mothers.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Short Handed
programme.desc: Dog's target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities. Unfortunately the team is missing a key player, Duane Lee is MIA today distracted by his new lady love.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Photo Op
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business. But the family comes together as they set out to hunt a chronic violator with an open warrant and a wife who has an odd request for Dog.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A House Divided
programme.desc: Dog has dropped Duane Lee from the team. When Leland confronts Dog and Beth about the decision tempers flare. But they have to come together to answer a cry for help from a mother who feels that the safest place for her daughter is jail.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Ties That Bind
programme.desc: With Duane Lee back on the team, the rift in the Chapman clan appears over. But will time heal this wound? As the family heads out for the seedier side of Honolulu in search of an erotic dancer, we will find out if the wound is truly healed.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Who's the Boss
programme.desc: When can a bounty hunt also be a date? When Dog and Beth decide to ride in the same SUV as they pursue a run away fugitive, will their different approaches to the investigation lead to a capture and romance?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bus Stop Bruiser
programme.desc: When an alleged abuser goes on the lame, Dog gathers the team to bring him in. As the leads grow colder Dog's determination only grows stronger. Finally, a hot lead comes in and Dog sets the trap for his prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Luck Be A Lady
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Behind the Hunt
programme.desc: The cameras are turned around, as we get a tour of life "behind the scenes" on Dog the Bounty Hunter. Using interviews with Dog and the posse, the TV crew, and never before seen footage, this is one of most revealing and heartfelt episodes of the series.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: God Looks on the Heart
programme.desc: This fugitive spells trouble for Dog in today's hunt. When the leads grow cold it's the US Postal Service to the rescue as a mail carrier lends a helping hand. Dog's team surrounds the suspected safe house and silently awaits their prey.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Big Brother
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in. Dog's plan is to convince family that everyone is best served if the fugitive mans up and takes care of business.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mid-Course Correction
programme.desc: Dog's target for today was once an upstanding member of his community. Now with no home, no job and the law on his trail, this middle-aged exile from middle-class society is using the cold end of an ice pipe to soothe his troubled soul.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Baby's Back in Town
programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive, named Wayne, by calling and telling him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it. Dog then sends his daughter, Lyssa, to "deliver" the vacuum cleaner and lure Wayne out of his house.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fathers in Law
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source, Bozo's father-in-law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surprise! Surprise!
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.(g)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Ice in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice-crystal methamphetamine-on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.(g)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fathers in Law
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source, Bozo's father-in-law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bosco the Clown
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Brother's Keeper
programme.desc: Leland has a full plate of fugitives in Kona, and the whole family heads to the Big Island to help.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mama's Boys
programme.desc: Dog visits his mother's grave for inspiration before heading out to find Frankie, a violent fugitive hiding in the jungle. The spirit of Ma Chapman seems to help when Dog finds an unusual ally; Frankie's mother.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Lost in Paradise
programme.desc: Dog lectures high school students about the dangers of drugs before going after Joseph, a dangerous fugitive who won't be easy to capture.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Coaching Day
programme.desc: Dog takes the day off to try his hand at coaching, and assigns Tim and Leland to track down a dangerous fugitive on their own. Can the boys prove they can handle it?(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Women of Waikiki
programme.desc: The boys get distracted by the bikini-clad lovelies on Waikiki when they hunt for Lucy, a homeless, alcoholic fugitive. Beth is amused by the boys, but this is serious business: Tim will have to pay the bond if Lucy isn't caught.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bass Man Standing
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Battle of the Brothers
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dyeing his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Aloha, Robertsons!
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii. But Willie's daily itinerary for the trip gets constantly undermined by the family's desire to participate in their own island activities.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Till Duck Do Us Part
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.sub-title: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance. When babysitting for Jep and Jessica turns into a rocky road.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hot Tub Grime Machine
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out. Godwin asks them to help him get a hot tub, so they set out to help him pick one up.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: A-Jase-ent Living
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends. Then, what begins in the duck call room as a series of "Gentlemen's Bets".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Termite Be a Problem
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from - Godwin's House. But while at Godwin's house, Godwin gets a taxidermied gift from a past relative.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Going Si-ral
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better. John Luke totals Willie's truck, and Willie realizes he may be raising the two worst drivers in all of Louisiana.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack-O-Lantern
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse." Everyone dresses up and Willie desperately tries to be the scariest, but none of the kids are afraid of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: O Little Town of West Monroe
programme.sub-title: O Little Town of West Monroe
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event. However, rehearsals get off to a bumpy start as the guys can't stop sharing their opinions.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Boomerang Becca
programme.desc: When Rebecca returns home from her internship in Los Angeles, the Robertson family plans a big surprise party to welcome her back. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si gets sick, he seeks the help of Ms. Kay to take care of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Willie's Number Two
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interviews her cousin, JD. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si spends the day over at Phil and Kay's, Jep stops by with the kids to keep them away from Jessica, who has taken ill.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Life of Si
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: From Duck 'til Dawn
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work, Jase and Willie head off to disarm it.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Burger Commander
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: G.I. Si
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old G.I. Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier. To settle the score, Willie and Jase head out to the woods with their friends and children for a paintball match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Big LeCOWski
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works. But when Willie questions Jase's ingenuity in creating new products they get into a debate.(g)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Governor's Travels
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack and Gown
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation. Willie and Si join in, and Jase tries to keep them from imparting their "college advice" on Reed.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hands on a Woodchipper
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize: a woodchipper.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack Draft
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day. Meanwhile, Phil and Si accompany Miss Kay on a trip to visit a family grave.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Brand of Brothers
programme.desc: When Willie contemplates re-branding the Duck Commander image, Jase takes issue with having an outsider design their image, so he and the guys create their own new logo and business cards. Meanwhile, Willie and Phil help Bella with her science project.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: De-Bug Life
programme.desc: The guys realize it is time for the annual cleaning of the duck blinds when they come across a gator using one as a home. Meanwhile, while the kids are running the church car wash, Si and Willie disagree on the best way to draw in customers.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jase and the Argonauts
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working. But when Jase thinks this is unfair, he takes matters into his own hands and finds a better object to use as motivation.(c)

programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep themselves. But the playhouse ends up looking more like a military-style duck blind.(c)

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Smoking Ton
programme.desc: WW2 Stuart M3 tank barrel and heavy duty tank treads; rare, collectors' 1890 silver inlayed humidor; high-end industrial meat slicer in the ultimate restaurant unit.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Real Thing

programme.desc: Ton & Allen face-off against an auction buyer with shady bidding tactics and even more questionable fashion sense. The guys find a custom-built monowheel & a rifle designed to ward off grave robbers in the early 19th century!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Hot Wheels
programme.desc: '70s sand rail dune racer with rally hemi heads; 1965 replica Mustang pool table; off-road racing gear.

programme.desc: Ton & Allen face some silent but deadly competition at an auction in nearby Glendale. They discover a Zildjian brand percussion cymbal from the 1940's and a pyrotechnics control board designed for large-scale fireworks displays!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Auction Hunters, Ink.
programme.desc: Autographed 1960s Bob Shaw Swing Gate tattoo machine; Terry Ives competition 22hp chainsaw; six foot chainsaw-carved cedar bear.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Reel Money
programme.desc: 1970's-era Fighting Chair used for big-game fishing; military MILES "laser tag" training system.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Big Score
programme.desc: At a climate-controlled storage facility in downtown L.A., Allen and Ton's locker wins score them an antique cash register and a German H&K pistol prized by collectors.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Fire in the Hole!
programme.desc: 1930s "blasting machine" dynamite detonator box; 1890s treasure chest with secret compartments. Ton smelts jewelry to forge bricks of silver.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Rodeo Ton
programme.desc: 1970s El Toro mechanical bull used to train bull riders; silver WWII era banjo; a collection of 1800s handcrafted hunting duck decoys.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Choo-Choo, Cha-Ching!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sink or Swim
programme.desc: 1905 Hand-crank Thomas Edison gramophone with cylindrical records; a discontinued Addictor 190 Mini Boat; a rare 1897 Regina music box.

programme.desc: 1870s French Jarre Dolne Knuckle Duster revolver-knife-brass knuckle combo, a rare original George Rodrigue "Blue Dog" screenprint and a 1980 autographed Raging Bull movie poster.

programme.desc: Allen &Ton enlist an assistant, Carolyn, and Allen's Hawaiian buddy, Junior, to help them battle local buyers. The guys find a WWII-era motor scooter and a stash of antique Polynesian tattoo tools that get used on Ton!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Hidden Hot Wheels
programme.desc: Ton and Allen challenge a big time auction buyer on his home turf. The guys uncover a 1969 Chevelle Malibu muscle car and a single-shot pistol designed to aid Allied resistance fighters during WWII.

programme.desc: Winchester 1886 rifle invented to kill buffalo; collection of 1950s electric Slot Cars.
